message.content:
cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY. 

The paper proposes a method for predicting driving intentions of nearby human-driving vehicles in a mixed-traffic scenario, which is a core problem in the field of autonomous driving (cs.RO). The method is based on Hidden Markov Model (HMM), which is a popular machine learning technique used in computer vision (cs.CV), natural language processing (cs.CL), and speech recognition (cs.SD). The paper also discusses the characterization of mobility features of vehicles, which is related to feature engineering and machine learning (cs.LG, cs.AI). Finally, the paper mentions the improvement of the proposed method when the surrounding traffic of the vehicle is taken into account, which is related to control systems (cs.SY).
